result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S. Hale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Andrea McFarlane  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to be on or around the premises of N4886 Badger Avenue, Chili WI or whatever premises she may live at.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted a payment plan of $100.00 per month to begin 12/01/2016.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant has 77 days of credit.  Defendant is granted Huber Privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S. Hale

records.addlTxt: Copy of Commitment Warrant sent to Clark Co Sheriff Dept

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Michael S. Hale, in custody, appeared with Attorney John T. Stichert.  Court sentences defendant.  120 days County Jail with huber, 77 days credit, DNA and surcharge, Pay plan of $100 to begin 12/1/16.
from Attorney John Stichert for an earlier sentencing date - granted
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
and entry of appearance by Attorney John Stichert
Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Michael S. Hale, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.

Pre-trial conference on April 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 5, 2016 at 09:20 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with A.M  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to be on or around the premises of N4886 Badger Avenue, Chili, WI.    Defendant must contact the Clark County Sheriff's Department within 48 hours to schedule and complete at the date and time designated by the Sheriff's Department, the booking process, which includes fingerprinting and photos.

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Michael S. Hale, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 09:20 am.
